channel.title: What's been going on?
channel.description:
Hi guys, haven't been on for a while. I've been pretty occupied with real life drama and military training. Also, doesn't help that I haven't been home for quite a few months now and haven't had access to internet other than on my phone at times. But, I have taken my computer and began working on a Rs2 base using the 525 protocol. Just too let you all know it has mulitplayer and a basic npc base
However, what is happening with everyone?

item.title: What's been going on?
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:21, topic:304219”][quote author=Graham link=topic=400512.msg2983191#msg2983191 date=1254759952]
Another problem you’d get is the maps could be slightly different, so people may appear to be walking through scenery. Same issue with NPCs.
[/quote]

Don’t all the clients since at least 317 support constructing maps from the server?[/quote]

It’s based on a palette of map regions. Like you can’t just say place this tile here, you can only base it on regions that already exist (and even then you are restricted by having to copy 8x8 areas).

Read full topic

item.title: What's been going on?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“oksuper_, post:23, topic:304219”][quote author=Taharok link=topic=400512.msg2983775#msg2983775 date=1254804238]

Another problem you’d get is the maps could be slightly different, so people may appear to be walking through scenery. Same issue with NPCs.

Don’t all the clients since at least 317 support constructing maps from the server?

I know 194-317 support that. Not sure about anything newer than that though.
[/quote]

Then you are dumb.[/quote]

Or maybe’s it’s because I find all newer versions boring. I wouldn’t call that being dumb, but rather being careless. Please learn to use words correctly next time.

Read full topic

item.title: What's been going on?
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Graham:

Another problem you’d get is the maps could be slightly different, so people may appear to be walking through scenery. Same issue with NPCs.

Same issue with basically everything. I think ry only bothered with this to have a server that could easily be updated to a new protocol. The whole “logging in with multiple clients at the same time” thing wouldn’t ever be used officially, or shouldn’t at least.

Read full topic

item.title: What's been going on?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“xEnt, post:16, topic:304219”]people can’t even implement a decent amount of packets for 1 protocol, let alone multiple. plus whats the point of having old client compatibility (lets say they are missing a skill) compared to a newer one. i think the amount of work isn’t worth the gain.[/quote]it could, however, be a strongpoint of private servers. maybe a new generation of hybrid servers will arise (something jagex could never do). it could simply be a one-upping of jagex although you would need some huge protocol translator system to account for the differences. it’d be pretty awesome though.

Read full topic

but as a technical exercise its nice to practice

item.title: What's been going on?
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

well for one some changes are huge between revisions, just take a look at the difference with the update server between 317 -424 yes you could have small gaps for example a server that could handle 424 - 443 but jagex tends to make major changes. so to do this would cause one hell of a compatibility headache… but hey we have interfaces for a reason right.

I’m still to lazy to write the update server part, but as far as the actual game you can see I have 317-508 working fine, although 317 has to run on a different port while the new engine clients share the main port. I’m guessing that this could solve the problem with the update server as well.

Read full topic

item.title: What's been going on?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

oksuper_:

Hello.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 25, 2009, 12:43:23 pm[/size][hr]‘525 base’… what is the point of that? Why do servers have set protocols they conform to? Why can’t a server be a system that was revision-independent, with all revision-specific protocol things being in providers for that revision?

well for one some changes are huge between revisions, just take a look at the difference with the update server between 317 -424 yes you could have small gaps for example a server that could handle 424 - 443 but jagex tends to make major changes. so to do this would cause one hell of a compatibility headache… but hey we have interfaces for a reason right.

Read full topic

item.title: What's been going on?

item.description:

Meh, I still think it’s cool ry60003333

item.title: What's been going on?
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

oksuper_:

‘525 base’… what is the point of that? Why do servers have set protocols they conform to? Why can’t a server be a system that was revision-independent, with all revision-specific protocol things being in providers for that revision?

That was one of my ideas, and I actually went out and did it. However, many of the people I show this too don’t give a care about it.

blitz_is_master_of_all.jpg1280×1024

with_hd.jpg1280×1024

Read full topic

Hiya Yz, good to have ya back for a bit.

item.title: What's been going on?
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Providers would do low-level things like encoding/decoding of different packets for a specific revision’s protocol. Ideally, packet encoding/decoding could be simplified greatly by doing things like:

[code]

public class SomePacketImpl extends … {

@Field(position = 0, positionType = ABSOLUTE), type = BYTE)
private int some_id;

@Field(position = 1, positionType = ABSOLUTE, type = SHORT)
private int some_other_id;

@Field(position = 0, positionType = RELATIVE_TO_OFFSET, type = ASCIZ)
private String some_text;

}[/code]

or something.

Read full topic

item.title: What's been going on?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“oksuper_, post:2, topic:304219”]Hello.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 25, 2009, 12:43:23 pm[/size][hr]‘525 base’… what is the point of that? Why do servers have set protocols they conform to? Why can’t a server be a system that was revision-independent, with all revision-specific protocol things being in providers for that revision?[/quote]That was my original plan and approach with OpenRS (I believe I was the first to come out with the idea too), unfortunately I didn’t (and still don’t) know the protocol well enough to complete even one “platform” as I called them, but “provider” sounds cooler.
Welcome back Yz, and good luck with your emulator.

Read full topic
